common_issues.title: Copilot Vague Response and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot providing vague responses instead of actionable solutions, particularly after multiple requests or with large contexts.  This issue might be connected to performance problems like slowness and lagging, especially on older macOS versions or specific LLM models.  Solutions include switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash, restarting Pieces OS, or updating to the latest Desktop app version.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Copilot not responding properly

**Key Points:**

* Sean reported an issue where the copilot was not responding to queries after 11 requests and responses, with no files loaded into the context.
* Mark suggested switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash.
* Sean confirmed that the issue was not replicated with Flash.

**Solutions:**

* Switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved with the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* The issue remains closed with the suggestion to reopen if the problem persists after the 11.2.3 update.

**Overall:**

The issue of the copilot not responding properly was reported and identified as a potential bug. The team suggested a solution that appears to have resolved the issue. The issue remains closed but will be reopened if the problem persists after the next update.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of Copilot Performance Issues on GitHub

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users reported drastic lagging and slowness after updating to Pieces OS 10.0.3 and Desktop application version 3.0.2. 
* This issue was first reported on July 17th, 2024 and persisted even after the initial patch release.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Bug in the copilot experience:** Clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" wasn't properly resetting a value, causing the websocket not to reinitialize correctly. 
* High CPU usage and blocked responses.
* Context files not being read despite specifying them.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Patch release:** A patch was released on July 19th, 2024, but the problem persisted for some users.
* **Real-time debugging:** The developer team offered to debug the issue in real-time through a chat. 
* **New Desktop app version:** Version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app was released on August 15th, 2024, containing significant performance improvements. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved for most users after updating to the new Desktop app version 3.1.0. However, one user reported the problem persisting on March 14th, 2025.
* The developer team has requested more information about the user's system to diagnose the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, high CPU usage, and lagging, particularly with Long Term Memory (LTM) enabled. Issues persist across Windows and macOS, impacting various apps. Proposed solutions include hotfixes, compatibility updates, and restarting LTM. While the Pieces team actively investigates, some users find relief after updates or workarounds.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* High CPU usage in Pieces OS with LTM2 enabled.
* Problem occurs on Windows and macOS.
* Symptoms include lag, sluggishness, and high CPU usage in apps like Discord and Microsoft Edge.

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential memory leak in LTM2.
* Possible compatibility issues with Microsoft Edge and WebView2 components.
* High CPU usage when VSCode plugin is used.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix released for initial issue, but didn't fully resolve the problem.
* Further updates released, including fixes for Microsoft Edge and WebView2 compatibility.
* Community workaround: restarting LTM2 can temporarily reduce CPU usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue still being actively investigated by Pieces team.
* Further updates expected in the future.
* Some users report improved performance after updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2 components.
* Other users still experiencing high CPU usage, particularly with VSCode plugin.

**Additional Notes:**

* Moving Pieces OS folders to a separate ReFS drive with symbolic links may improve performance.
* KnifMelti's findings regarding Microsoft Edge and WebView2 updates suggest that compatibility issues may be a contributing factor.
* The issue seems to be more prevalent on Windows machines.

**Overall, the problem is not fully resolved but the Pieces team is actively working on a fix. They appreciate users' continued patience and feedback.**

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User @bpluly experienced several issues with the Pieces app, including slow performance and crashes.
* The user uninstalled the app due to frustration.

**Problems identified:**

* Long Term Memory feature slows down PC performance.
* PiecesOS crashes and takes a long time to boot up.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces support bot provides links to related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces from the Pieces team offers a call to discuss the user's experience and troubleshoot the issues.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User @bpluly has not responded to the offer of a call.
* The issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue was created on March 14, 2025.
* The last update was on March 18, 2025.

Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

**Key Points:**

* User (@kwburgess) experienced issues activating LTM in Pieces.

* The user was directed to relevant resources like existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel for future reference.

**Notes:**

* It’s possible that user was trying to manually transfer data rather than using proper backup/restore procedures
* Issue resolution was likely contingent on further user interaction, either with the proposed solutions or by scheduling the call

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation regarding Connection Issues between Pieces for Developers and Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi was experiencing issues getting Pieces for Developers to connect to Pieces OS after a significant update.
* The issue seemed related to the database in the Pieces for Developers app and potentially something in the user's setup.

**Problems Identified:**

* MoyinShabi was unable to boot the Pieces for Developers app.
* An error message "Error Initializing DB 1 - Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type gAb is not registered inside GetIt." was appearing in the logs.
* Mack was unable to fully reproduce the issue despite identifying and fixing a potential bug.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack requested various log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder from MoyinShabi to investigate the issue.
* Mack identified a bug in the "com.pieces.pfd" folder and provided a repaired version to MoyinShabi.
* Mack suggested a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* MoyinShabi replaced their existing "com.pieces.pfd" folder with the repaired version provided by Mack but still encountered the same issue.
* The problem seems to be related to the GetIt flutter package not finding a specific dependency.
* A follow-up video call was scheduled to further troubleshoot the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was reported on March 4, 2025.
* The latest update from Mack was on March 18, 2025.
* It is unclear whether the issue has been fully resolved.

## Summary of Copilot Performance Issues on GitHub

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users reported drastic lagging and slowness after updating to Pieces OS 10.0.3 and Desktop application version 3.0.2. 
* This issue was first reported on July 17th, 2024 and persisted even after the initial patch release.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Bug in the copilot experience:** Clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" wasn't properly resetting a value, causing the websocket not to reinitialize correctly. 
* High CPU usage and blocked responses.
* Context files not being read despite specifying them.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Patch release:** A patch was released on July 19th, 2024, but the problem persisted for some users.
* **Real-time debugging:** The developer team offered to debug the issue in real-time through a chat. 
* **New Desktop app version:** Version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app was released on August 15th, 2024, containing significant performance improvements. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved for most users after updating to the new Desktop app version 3.1.0. However, one user reported the problem persisting on March 14th, 2025.
* The developer team has requested more information about the user's system to diagnose the issue.

recommendations: **Address Pieces OS Performance:** Investigate and address the root causes of slow performance, high CPU usage, and lagging reported in Pieces OS, especially those related to Long Term Memory (LTM).  Prioritize solutions for both Windows and macOS, focusing on compatibility with M3 chips.

**Improve Copilot Responsiveness:** Investigate and resolve issues with Copilot providing vague responses or no response, particularly after multiple requests or with large contexts. Focus on improving performance and compatibility with older macOS versions and specific LLM models.

**Enhance Pieces OS and Desktop App Connection Stability:** Address issues related to backup/restore failures, personal domain conflicts, and app launch errors. Improve communication and guidance for users experiencing these issues, ensuring clear instructions for troubleshooting and resolution.

**Proactively Monitor and Address Common Errors:**  Implement monitoring systems to detect and address common errors like "This message is empty" or "Invalid Port" promptly. Provide clear error messages and troubleshooting steps to users within the application.

**Improve Personal Domain Management:** Simplify the process of changing or registering personal domains to avoid conflicts and confusion. Provide clear guidance and error messages related to personal domain availability and registration.

**Review Installation Process:** Investigate reports of installation issues, including those related to default installation locations and antivirus software flagging Pieces OS. Ensure a smooth and user-friendly installation experience across different operating systems and setups.

**Gather Detailed System Information:** During support interactions, prioritize gathering comprehensive system information from users experiencing issues. This includes operating system versions, Pieces OS versions, hardware specifications, and relevant log files. This will expedite troubleshooting and bug fixing.

**Enhance Communication and Transparency:** Keep users informed about ongoing investigations, planned bug fixes, and new releases through various channels like release notes, blog posts, and social media updates.  Provide clear and timely communication regarding known issues and workarounds.
